result.execSummary:
Sarah B Olson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Sarah B Olson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah B Olson

records.addlTxt:
1:47 PM Defendant Sarah B Olson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Sarah B Olson.  Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for State of Wisconsin. 
THIS COVERS 22CF183 & 22CM151. 
22CF183 - Defendant waives right to extradition. Court questions the defendant. Court accepts the waiver.  A waiver will be signed by the Defendant and the Court. 

22CM151 - State moves to amend count 1 to 9.12 (theft). Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 
Court orders $267.50 total forfeiture with 60 days to pay or payment plan and $62.42 restitution to Kwik Trip. 
State moves to amend count 2 to 9.16 (resisting). Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads no contest. 
Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. Court orders a $267.50 total forfeiture with 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
Court orders the Defendant contact the Clerk's Office within 30 days to set up a payment plan. 

02:07 Case recalled. Waiver of Extradition signed by the Defendant in front of the court. 

CC: BC Jail.

1:07 PM Defendant Sarah B Olson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Sarah B Olson for today.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Covers 22CF183 and 22CM151
Attorney Rockow requests bond modification.  State relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and denies bond modification.  Bond remains as set.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 
Defendant shall not post more then $5000.00 for case files 22CF183 & 22CM151.

1:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarah B Olson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alex Kitto in court for Sarah B Olson. 
THIS COVERS 22CF183 & 22CM151. 

Court questions the defendant regarding demographic information. 
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. Parties in break out room. 1:24 Parties return, court resumes. 

Attorney Kitto relates. 
22CF183 - Defendant does not waive extradition. Status hearing set. 
22CM151 - Bond set. AIA scheduled before Judge Babler.
Status hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
